briefTitle: 2. Study to Evaluate the Efficacy/Safety of Bremelanotide in Premenopausal Women With Hypoactive Sexual Desire Disorder
officialTitle: Phase 3, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Trial With an Open-label Extension Phase to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Subcutaneously Bremelanotide in Premenopausal Women With Hypoactive Sexual Desire Disorder (HSDD)
summary: A Phase 3, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Parallel-group Trial with an optional Open-label Extension to evaluate the efficacy of bremelanotide (BMT), administered subcutaneously (SC) on an as needed basis for the treatment of HSDD (with or without decreased arousal) in premenopausal females.

primaryOutcome.measure: Efficacy of a Fixed Dose of Bremelanotide as Measured by FSFI (Question Q1 and Q2), 28-day Recall.
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: 8 weeks baseline plus 24 weeks (Main Study), 52 Weeks (OLE)
